description.narrative: Research shows that global education goals are not visible in everyday life of schools. Teachers do not receive enough in-service training in global education and they need support in cooperation with NGOs. Global School is a bridge between NGOs and school s. With the help of Global School educators can find support in implementing critical global education based on development policy Agenda 2030 and the new curricula. The 200 000 visits in its website show the significance of the project. Global School has become an established part of local global education strategies in several municipalities.Global School offers tools for educators from early childhood to the secondary level to accomplish global education in their everyday work. Global School has both nat ional and regional activities and internet services.In the period 2017-18 Global School will create ?The 17 goals? internet-based service that will put the Agenda 2030 goals into practise in schools. Global School has a comprehensive internet site where th e global education themes are divided according to different school subjects topics age groups theme days and methods. Cooperating NGOs have been selected based on their expertise in the fields of development goals and the focal areas of the Finnish develo pment policy programme.Regional activities are produced in cooperation with the local education departments. In the period 2017-18 cooperation is launched with the city of Joensuu. The regional activities continue in Oulu Turku Kokkola and Tampere. Further Global School Suitcases are available in Satakunta and Helsinki.Regional activities of Global School include in-service training in cooperation with other NGOs. Global Schools Suitcases can also be borrowed containing materials from different NGOs. The ma terials are based on different themes and include lesson and period plans suitable for learners of different ages.Notably Global School has created a teacher network. The teachers in the network get their financial compensation from the municipalities. The Global School coordinator plans the trainings and activities in cooperation with the network teachers. A total of 138 402 grant has been approved by MoFA to this two-year project.
